answer:
When a child starts their immunizations late, a schedule designed to bring them up to date with their immunizations as quickly as possible is used. The child will be offered all of the vaccines they are eligible for at the time of each visit.  
A public health nurse can review the recommended schedule with you and answer any further questions you may have.  You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here: http://immunizebc.ca/finder.
answer_formatted:
## When a child starts their immunizations late, a schedule designed to bring them up to date with their immunizations as quickly as possible is used.


## The child will be offered all of the vaccines they are eligible for at the time of each visit.

A public health nurse can review the recommended schedule with you and answer any further questions you may have.
You can find the contact information for your local public health unit here:http://immunizebc.
ca/finder.
question: I recently decided to get my 10 month old daughter vaccinated. She's had no shots yet. What happens now? Does she get all the shots she missed at once?
question_variation_0: do i miss shots for a month without vaccinations
question_variation_1: how many shots can my daughter miss with no shots
question_variation_2: how long can you wait to get shots after vaccinated
